result.traction: Compared to rigid tourism planning, what do I think is better?
result.label: You feel it might be better to go with the flow, after all, plans are rigid, but people are flexible.
result.hlfs_answer: I believe that being flexible and going with the flow is better than rigid tourism planning. Plans are rigid, but people are flexible, and traveling spontaneously can unleash inner freedom and joy. While planning provides a sense of direction, flexibility and interests often change during the journey. Therefore, keeping an open mind during your trip to Beidaihe, adjusting your itinerary based on real-time feelings and interests, and enjoying every unexpected discovery and exploration would be a great approach.
result.mb_answer: As I recall from our previous conversation, you mentioned, "Actually, I feel it might be better to go with the flow, after all, plans are rigid, but people are flexible." This suggests that you believe in being more flexible and adaptable when it comes to travel planning. By being open to spontaneous experiences and adjustments along the way, you can embrace unexpected opportunities and enjoy a more relaxed and stress-free journey. Flexibility allows for more freedom to explore, discover hidden gems, and create memorable experiences that may not have been part of a rigid itinerary. It's all about finding a balance between planning and spontaneity to make the most of your travel adventures.
result.scm_answer: You feel that going with the flow and being flexible is better than rigid tourism planning.
